title: A crazy trade inquiry, and some not as crazy ones
author: DerekMichael

posts.post_title: A crazy trade inquiry, and some not as crazy ones
posts.post_content:
Greetings Fellas.

There are a few combos I am interested in acquiring for my rare back collection, and the following three can be used in trade: Tinker- Lenox, Evers - Broad Leaf, Bender - Carolina Brights.

I am interested in the following: Young and Johnson Brown Hindu's, a HOF Broad Leaf 460 (lol), and a Lajoie batting (I am a bit more open for the back on this one, although the very, very scarce American Beauty 460 or Cycle 460 would be pretty amazing).

On a side note: is there anyone who has a spare Eddie Plank lying around that they would trade for my rare back HOF run? :D

If you want to chat trade give me a jingle. Thank you very much for your time.

Derek
Those are some great cards, wow! Good luck.

Hi Derek,

PM sent regarding my "spare" Plank.

Hank

[quote name="hank_jp" post=1443855]Hi Derek,

PM sent regarding my "spare" Plank.

Hank[/QUOTE]

You have a spare "Plank"?  Wow I'm in the wrong business.

[quote name="Pilot172000" post=1443929]You have a spare "Plank"?  Wow I'm in the wrong business.[/QUOTE]

That's what I'm saying

Do you have a spare Wagner ???? I was thinking of acquiring one.


But in all seriousness if you have a spare plank do you have a spare Cobb ????

Oh leave it to my dad to stir up the thread :)

Best wishes,
Scott

Hey Scott,
       Your Dad only has one spare Plank??? I assumed he had 4-5 at least.:D
         Hope you are well Brian

is the man..:).........he has probably owned about every card just about printed at one time;)...

a modest guy, but a wealth o' knowledge..;)......

Hank, like Brian, thanks for a lot of the education over the last decade or so:)
